predictions.text: ISM Services PMI (headline, SA) for October 2025 will print between 51.0 and 53.5 in ISM’s release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the ISM Services PMI headline index value for October 2025 from the Institute for Supply Management’s official release. Success if the reported headline is ≥51.0 and ≤53.5.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global U.S. Services PMI (flash/final) for October
High-frequency card spending and mobility data
NFIB small-business hiring plans and sales expectations
ISM Services New Orders and Employment subindices
predictions.rationale: Services momentum remains modest with softer demand, rising credit frictions, and fiscal uncertainty; a mid-51s to low-53s print is most likely.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI Headline (MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between 0.0% and 0.3% in the BLS release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the Bureau of Labor Statistics CPI-U headline month-over-month percent change (seasonally adjusted) for October 2025. Success if the value is ≥0.0% and ≤0.3%.
monitoring_signals: AAA daily gasoline prices and regional fuel trends
Manheim Used Vehicle Value Index (seasonally adjusted)
Zillow Observed Rent Index and private measures of rent inflation
Utility gas and electricity price components; food commodity benchmarks
predictions.rationale: Energy pass-through is muted and core goods remain soft; shelter disinflation should offset stickier services.

predictions.text: U.S. JOLTS hires rate for September 2025 will print between 3.4% and 3.7% in the BLS release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the JOLTS hires rate (hires as a percent of employment) for September 2025 from BLS. Success if the hires rate is ≥3.4% and ≤3.7%.
monitoring_signals: Initial jobless claims and continuing claims trends
Indeed job postings and LinkedIn hiring rate
NFIB hiring plans and compensation plans
Challenger job-cuts announcements
predictions.rationale: Labor demand is cooling but not collapsing; hires rate should drift near mid-3s amid tighter credit and softer growth.

predictions.text: Japan Tokyo CPI excluding fresh food (YoY) for October 2025 will print between 2.0% and 2.8%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Statistics Bureau of Japan’s Tokyo CPI ex fresh food YoY for October 2025. Success if the YoY rate is ≥2.0% and ≤2.8%.
monitoring_signals: Tokyo electricity/gas tariffs and food price changes
JPY exchange rate and import price indices
Prior Tokyo CPI trend and base effects
predictions.rationale: Underlying inflation is easing from peaks but remains above 2% amid pass-through and sticky services.

predictions.text: China exports (USD, YoY) for October 2025 will print between -4% and +4% in the Customs release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the General Administration of Customs of China headline exports YoY (USD terms) for October 2025. Success if the YoY change is ≥-4% and ≤+4%.
monitoring_signals: South Korea daily/export data (leading indicator)
China PMI new export orders (NBS/Caixin)
Global container spot rates (Drewry WCI, FBX)
Semiconductor shipment/value indices
predictions.rationale: External demand is mixed; electronics cycle recovery offsets weak consumer goods. Base effects constrain large YoY swings.

predictions.text: AAA U.S. national average diesel price will print at or below $3.90 per gallon on at least one daily reading.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use AAA’s published national average diesel price series. Success if any daily national reading on or before 2025-11-30 is ≤ $3.90 per gallon.
monitoring_signals: AAA daily diesel prices
EIA distillate inventories and implied demand
ULSD crack spreads and refinery utilization
Global crude benchmarks (Brent/WTI) and freight
predictions.rationale: Shoulder-season demand and adequate inventories could pressure diesel; risks stem from refining outages and geopolitical shocks.

predictions.text: ICE BofA MOVE Index will close at or above 115.0 on at least one trading day (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm any official ICE Data Indices or Bloomberg-published daily close of the MOVE Index at ≥115.0 on or before 2025-11-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: FOMC communications and rate-path repricing
Treasury auction outcomes and term premium moves
Macro surprise indices and inflation prints
Swaption-implied rate volatility
predictions.rationale: Policy and growth uncertainty keep rate vol elevated; a brief spike above 115 is plausible around key data or policy events.

predictions.text: From 2025-10-18 close to 2025-11-30 close, Zions Bancorporation (ZION) will underperform SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF (KRE) by at least 6.0 percentage points based on adjusted close percentage change.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Yahoo Finance (adjusted close) for ZION and KRE, compute percentage change from 2025-10-18 close to 2025-11-30 close. Success if (ZION% − KRE%) ≤ -6.0 pp.
monitoring_signals: ZION headlines: legal, regulatory, credit-quality updates
Regional bank credit spreads and KRE constituent performance
Deposit flows and funding cost commentary
Short interest and options skew in ZION
predictions.rationale: Company-specific governance risk likely weighs on ZION relative to peers amid a cautious regional-bank backdrop.

predictions.text: Walmart (WMT) Q3 FY2026 U.S. comparable sales ex-fuel will print between 3.0% and 5.0%, per the company’s earnings release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check Walmart’s Q3 FY2026 earnings release/investor presentation for U.S. comparable sales excluding fuel. Success if reported comp is ≥3.0% and ≤5.0%.
monitoring_signals: Company guidance and traffic/transactions commentary
Census retail sales (general merchandise, grocery)
Third-party foot traffic and web analytics
Inflation trends in grocery and consumables
predictions.rationale: Value-focused retail remains resilient; traffic and market share gains should support mid-single-digit comps ex-fuel.

predictions.text: English Wikipedia (en.wikipedia.org) total pageviews (all-access) for October 2025 will be at least 8% lower than October 2024, per Wikimedia REST API.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Wikimedia REST API monthly pageviews for en.wikipedia.org, all-access, agent=user for 2024-10 and 2025-10. Success if 2025-10 total ≤ 92% of 2024-10 total.
monitoring_signals: Search engine result page features (AI summaries, panels)
Referral share trends from search/social to Wikipedia
Wikimedia referrer breakdown and device mix
Major news-cycle intensity (affects baseline traffic)
predictions.rationale: AI answer surfaces and short-form video are diverting information queries from Wikipedia, pressuring YoY pageviews.

predictions.text: EUR/JPY (EURJPY=X) will trade at or above 164.00 on at least one UTC trading day.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance or equivalent for EURJPY intraday highs on or before 2025-11-30 (UTC). Success if any day’s high ≥ 164.00.
monitoring_signals: BoJ policy communications and inflation data
U.S. and euro area rate differentials vs Japan
Risk sentiment and carry-trade dynamics
EZ PMIs and German data surprises
predictions.rationale: Wide rate differentials and supportive risk tone could lift EURJPY to prior highs; intervention risk limits confidence.

predictions.text: Aggregate EU natural gas storage (AGSI+, EU total) will be at or above 95.0% of capacity on at least one day between 2025-10-20 and 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check AGSI+ (Aggregated Gas Storage Inventory) EU total storage percentage. Success if any daily reading from 2025-10-20 through 2025-11-30 is ≥95.0%.
monitoring_signals: AGSI+ daily storage levels and injection/withdrawal pace
European weather forecasts and HDDs
Norway/LNG flows and unplanned outages
Dutch TTF price action and volatility
predictions.rationale: EU storage entered winter near record highs; mild early-season temps and steady supply should keep inventories ≥95% at least briefly.
